title: Erdogan says Trump meeting with Arab, Muslim leaders on Gaza was ‘fruitful’
summary: Trump presents plan on ending war on margins of UNGA dominated by Gaza, billed meeting as 'the group that could do it'.

title: Jimmy Kimmel addresses Charlie Kirk row as show returns
summary: US TV host Jimmy Kimmel said it was ‘never his intention’ to make light of the killing of Charlie Kirk.

title: Satirical statue in DC notes ‘long-lasting bond’ between Trump, Epstein
summary: On a plaque, unknown artists said it was displayed 'in honour of friendship month' for the two men.

title: LIVE: Israel kills dozens of Palestinians in attacks on war-devastated Gaza
summary: Death toll surges in early Israeli bombardment with the heaviest carnage in besieged Gaza City.

title: ‘Too scared’: How Nepal violence is still hurting India border trade
summary: Markets are empty and people are spending less. Along the open India-Nepal border, that's devastating for traders.

title: ‘You’re destroying your countries’: Key moments from Trump’s UN speech
summary: Trump's UN speech highlighted immigration, foreign policy, war resolutions, the strikes on Iran and Venezuelan boats.

title: Gaza aid flotilla hit by drone attacks and explosions, activists say
summary: Activists on board the Global Sumud Flotilla said they heard explosions and saw drone attacks late on Tuesday.

title: Super Typhoon Ragasa kills 14 in Taiwan, hits Hong Kong with fierce winds
summary: Taiwanese authorities say 124 people are missing after barrier lake burst its banks in rural township.

title: UN denies sabotage after escalator malfunctions as Trump steps on
summary: International body says mishap appears to have been caused by accidental triggering of built-in safety mechanism.

title: Trump administration rehires laid-off employees after cost-cutting blitz
summary: Hundreds of US employees fired on Elon Musk's watch are being asked to return to work, internal memo shows.

title: Where and how to watch Jimmy Kimmel Live! And who is boycotting?
summary: As Kimmel returns, he is expected to address the controversy that led major station groups to drop his late-night show.

title: Colombia blasts genocidal Israel and allies over Gaza atrocities
summary: Colombian President Gustavo Petro told the UNGA the world must end the “genocide in Gaza."

title: La flottille pour Gaza dénonce une nouvelle attaque de drones au large de la Grèce
summary: La flottille humanitaire pour Gaza s'est dite ciblée dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi par une nouvelle attaque de drones alors qu'elle naviguait au sud-ouest de la Crète. "De multiples drones, des objets non identifiés largués, des communications brouillées et des explosions entendues depuis plusieurs bateaux", a décrit la flottille, qui n'a pas fait état de victimes ou de dégâts.

title: Quels sont les pays qui ne reconnaissent pas la Palestine et pourquoi ?
summary: Près de 80 % des membres de l'ONU reconnaissent désormais l'État de Palestine, dont la France depuis lundi. Mais près de 40 États rejettent cette idée, surtout pour des raisons de loyauté envers les États-Unis. Tour du monde des oppositions.

title: Palestine : une reconnaissance, quelles avancées ? Parlons-en avec A. Corpet, B. Nabli et J. Soufi
summary: Après les mots du président Emmanuel Macron à la tribune des Nations unies, que change cette reconnaissance pour les Palestiniens et Palestiniennes ? Peut-elle influer sur le court de la guerre qui se poursuit à Gaza ou sur la colonisation qui va en s'accélérant ? Quelle marge de manœuvre face à un gouvernement israélien, soutenu par les États-Unis, qui affirme, lui, qu'un Etat palestinien ne verra jamais le jour ?

title: En images : l'intensification de la colonisation en Cisjordanie occupée
summary: En Cisjordanie occupée, le gouvernement israélien a accéléré ses projets de colonisation sur un territoire de plus en plus morcelé. De Jérusalem-Est à Naplouse, les envoyés spéciaux de France 24 décrivent l'impact des colonies israéliennes sur la vie quotidienne des Palestiniens.

title: La reconnaissance de l'État palestinien, un non-évènement pour les habitants de Ramallah
summary: En Cisjordanie occupée, les habitants n'expriment aucun enthousiasme quant aux retombées de la reconnaissance par la France et plusieurs autres pays de l'État de Palestine.

title: Cisjordanie, route 60 : l'incontournable "route de la mort" pour des milliers de Palestiniens
summary: En Cisjordanie, la route 60 relie entre elles les principales villes palestiniennes mais aussi les colonies israéliennes. Itinéraire incontournable pour relier Naplouse à Ramallah, les Palestiniens l'empruntent la peur au ventre, craignant la violence des colons, qui s'est déchaînée depuis les attentats du 7-Octobre. Reportage.

title: Manifestations pour Gaza en Italie : "Un monde qui raconte un pays différent"
summary: A la Une de la presse, ce mardi 23 septembre, les manifestations contre la guerre à Gaza en Italie et les réactions au discours, hier, à l’ONU, d’Emmanuel Macron sur la reconnaissance de la Palestine par la France. Une décision largement perçue comme un "défi" à l’égard des Etats-Unis. Le projet d’établir un "mur de drones" à la frontière orientale de l’UE. Et la cérémonie du Ballon d’or, hier soir.

title: État de Palestine : les Israéliens majoritairement opposés à la reconnaissance
summary: Israël avait déjà critiqué l'annonce française, avant même le discours d'Emmanuel Macron reconnaissant l'existence d'un État palestinien. Les explications de notre correspondante à Jérusalem.

title: Pour l'Autorité palestinienne, "cette reconnaissance doit être accompagnée de mesures concrètes"
summary: L'Autorité palestinienne a été l'une des premières à réagir dans la foulée du discours du président français reconnaissant l'État de Palestine à l'ONU, saluant une décision "historique et courageuse". Les explications de notre envoyée spéciale à Ramallah.

title: "Une décision historique" : les réactions après la reconnaissance de la Palestine par la France
summary: Les réactions en France et à l'international se multipliaient, lundi, après l'annonce officielle par Emmanuel Macron de la reconnaissance de l'État de Palestine par la France, à l'ouverture de la grand-messe annuelle des Nations unies à New York.

title: Reconnaissance de l'État de Palestine : le point de vue d'Hala Abou-Hassira
summary: "Par cette reconnaissance, ces pays défendent aussi le droit des Palestiniens à l'autodétermination", estime Hala Abou-Hassira, ambassadrice de la Palestine en France alors que Paris et d'autres pays s'apprêtent à reconnaître l'État de Palestine à l'occasion de l'Assemblée générale à New York.

title: Un État palestinien reconnu, et après ?...
summary: Dix pays, dont la France, le Royaume-Uni, le Canada et l’Australie, ont annoncé reconnaître l’État palestinien. Emmanuel Macron s’exprimera ce soir à la tribune de l’Assemblée générale des Nations unies, à New York. Israël réagit vivement et envisage de fermer le consulat français à Jérusalem. Washington, opposé à cette reconnaissance, tente d’en limiter la portée diplomatique.

title: En direct, Gaza : Jean-Luc Mélenchon dénonce une attaque contre « des gens sans défense » à bord de la flottille pour Gaza
summary: Les militants propalestiniens de la flottille en route pour la bande de Gaza ont affirmé, mardi, avoir été visés au large de la Grèce par de multiples drones. « Où est la marine nationale de la France qui reconnaît l’Etat de Palestine assiégé ? » a demandé le leader de LFI.

title: « Put Your Soul on Your Hand and Walk », film tombeau de la photographe palestinienne Fatma Hassona
summary: Dans ce puissant documentaire, Sepideh Farsi révèle ses échanges téléphoniques avec la jeune femme qui a documenté le quotidien dans Gaza, avant sa mort, le 16 avril, victime d’une attaque israélienne.

title: Avec son documentaire « A 2 000 mètres d’Andriïvka », Mstyslav Chernov nous plonge en immersion au cœur des combats entre Russes et Ukrainiens
summary: Le photoreporter de guerre ukrainien montre avec une grande force le cauchemar et l’absurdité du conflit.

title: « L’isolement d’Israël est le prix de la poursuite d’une guerre sans buts convaincants à Gaza et de la prédation territoriale en Cisjordanie »
summary: En comparant son pays à la Sparte de la Grèce antique, le premier ministre israélien, Benyamin Nétanyahou, assume le choix d’une ambition autarcique nourrie par une lecture paranoïaque du monde, estime dans sa chronique Gilles Paris, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Mort de Claudia Cardinale : « Muse des plus grands, elle incarna avec éclat la liberté, la force et l’élégance »
summary: Les hommages se multiplient après la mort de l’actrice, mardi à l’âge de 87 ans. Connue pour ses rôles dans « Le Guépard », « Il était une fois dans l’Ouest » ou « Huit et demi », elle inspira les grands noms du cinéma italien, de Luchino Visconti à Federico Fellini, en passant par Sergio Leone.

title: Jimmy Kimmel, de retour à l’antenne de la chaîne ABC, reconnaît des propos « mal choisis ou ambigus » à propos de la mort de Charlie Kirk
summary: La suspension du « Jimmy Kimmel Live ! » avait provoqué un tollé aux Etats-Unis, où beaucoup y ont vu un prétexte pour se débarrasser de l’animateur, critique inlassable du président américain. Avant l’émission, Donald Trump avait promis de « mettre à l’épreuve ABC à propos de cela ».

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : Emmanuel Macron salue les déclarations de Donald Trump qui estime que l’Ukraine « peut reconquérir l’ensemble » de son territoire
summary: Le président ukrainien, Volodymyr Zelensky, s’est aussi dit satisfait du « tournant » opéré par son homologue américain. Un peu plus tôt à la tribune des Nations unies, Donald Trump a demandé aux pays européens de cesser « immédiatement » leurs achats d’or noir russe.

title: Donald Trump fait une volte-face sur l’Ukraine et, devant les Nations unies, la leçon aux Européens
summary: Le président américain a opéré, mardi, un renversement radical de sa propre ligne sur le conflit ukrainien, estimant que Kiev était « en mesure de reprendre le pays dans sa forme originelle ». A l’ONU, il a fustigé les politiques migratoires et énergétiques des pays du Vieux Continent.

title: Alexus Grynkewich, chef des armées de l’OTAN en Europe : « En cas de menace avérée, nous sommes prêts à défendre nos populations »
summary: Alors que les répercussions du conflit ukrainien se font de plus en plus sentir sur le Vieux Continent, le nouveau commandant suprême des forces alliées en Europe, en visite en France mercredi, évoque les mesures et les stratégies destinées à parer aux actions qui viseraient les pays membres.

title: Supertyphon Ragasa : la rupture d’une digue à Taïwan provoque la mort d’au moins 14 personnes
summary: Plus de 150 personnes sont portées disparues alors qu’un lac formé il y a plusieurs années par un glissement de terrain a inondé une ville voisine. Dans le sud de la Chine, Hongkong a été placé en alerte maximale.

title: En Turquie, une militante féministe retire le voile qu’elle portait depuis des décennies
summary: Journaliste, historienne, musulmane pratiquante, Berrin Sönmez a décidé de renoncer au port du foulard en protestation à un sermon officiel consacré à la « pudeur » et la « décence ».

title: A New York, Emmanuel Macron annonce un système de bourse pour des étudiants américains
summary: La Lafayette Fellowship permettra d’accueillir chaque année 30 brillants étudiants américains en master. Une façon de développer un soft power outre-Atlantique au moment où les relations avec Washington connaissent de nombreuses turbulences.

title: Syria, Israel near 'de-escalation' pact, US envoy says
summary:
Syria, Israel near 'de-escalation' pact, US envoy says

Syria and Israel are close to striking a "de-escalation" agreement in which Israel will stop its attacks while Syria will agree to not move any machinery or heavy equipment near the Israeli border, a senior US envoy said on Tuesday.

Speaking to reporters on the sidelines of UN General Assembly meetings in New York, US Special Envoy for Syria Tom Barrack said the agreement would serve as the first step towards the security deal that the two countries have been negotiating.

Syria and Israel are in talks to reach an agreement that Damascus hopes will secure a halt to Israeli air strikes and the withdrawal of Israeli military forces who have pushed into southern Syria.

Syrian President Ahmad al Shaara on Tuesday blamed Israel for stalling on negotiations and invading the Syrian airspace.

“We are not the ones creating problems for Israel. We are scared of Israel, not the other way around,” he said during an event of the Middle East Institute.

“There are multiple risks with Israel stalling on the negotiations and insisting on violating our airspace and incursions into our territory,” he said.

title: Israeli forces arrest three children near Ramallah, says report
summary:
Israeli forces arrest three children near Ramallah, says report

Israeli forces arrested three children from the village of Deir Abu Mash’al, northwest of Ramallah in occupied West Bank on Wednesday, Wafa news agency reported.

Security sources told Wafa that the Israeli forces arrested Yousef Adeeb Atta, 13, Saif Ali al-Barghouthi, 14, and Mahmoud Zahran, 15, after raiding their homes and searching them.

The sources said Israeli forces also entered the town of Turmus Ayya, northeast of Ramallah, driving military vehicles through the streets, raiding several homes, and seizing several vehicles.

title: Report: Three aid seeking Palestinians killed in southern Gaza
summary:
Report: Three aid seeking Palestinians killed in southern Gaza

Israeli forces have shot at and killed at least three Palestinian aid seekers in Gaza, according to Al Jazeera, citing a local ambulance source.

Other people were injured in the attack.

title: Japan PM says Palestine state recognition 'when not if'
summary:
Japan PM says Palestine state recognition 'when not if'

Japan's prime minister told the United Nations on Tuesday that Tokyo's recognition of the State of Palestine was only a question of time, saying he was "indignant" at recent comments by Israeli officials.

Nearly 80 percent of UN members recognise the State of Palestine, with a string of countries including Britain, Canada and France adding their names this week after Israel's nearly two years of war on Gaza.

"I feel strongly indignant at the statements made by senior Israeli government officials that appear to categorically reject the very notion of Palestinian state-building," Shigeru Ishiba said.

"For our country, the question is not whether recognise a Palestinian state, but when. The continued unilateral actions by the government of Israel can never be accepted," he said.

"I must state clearly that if further actions are taken that obstruct the realisation of a two-state solution, Japan will be compelled to take new measures in response," he added.

title: Footage shows attack on global Sumud flotilla
summary:
Footage shows attack on global Sumud flotilla

The Gaza Sumud Flotilla, carrying aid to the Strip, has shared footage that appears to show an explosion that detonated on the flotilla earlier.

The activists said late Tuesday they heard explosions and saw multiple drones that targeted some of their boats, currently situated off Greece.

"Multiple drones, unidentified objects dropped, communications jammed and explosions heard from a number of boats," the Global Sumud Flotilla said in a statement, without adding whether there were any casualties.

"We are witnessing these psychological operations firsthand, right now, but we will not be intimidated," the statement said.

German human rights activist and flotilla member Yasemin Acar said in a video she posted on Instagram that five vessels had been attacked.

"We are carrying only humanitarian aid," she said. "We have no weapons. We pose no threat to anyone. It is Israel who is killing thousands of people (and) starving a whole population."

Video of one the explosions happening now on the flotilla filmed from the Spectre boat.

Raise the alarm! All eyes on the Global Sumud Flotilla#globalsumudflotilla #freepalestine #breakthesiege #sailtogaza #urgentalert https://t.co/A3S5PGUQ7T

— Global Sumud Flotilla (@gbsumudflotilla) September 23, 2025

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

 Good morning, Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from the Israeli war on Gaza, now in its 718th day: 

  • Australia's public broadcaster was ordered Wednesday to pay a hefty penalty to a radio journalist dismissed for reposting to Instagram a Human Rights Watch video report on Gaza.

  • Organisers of a Gaza-bound Sumud flotilla carrying aid and pro-Palestinian activists said late Tuesday they heard explosions and saw multiple drones that targeted some of their boats, currently situated off Greece.

  • G7 Foreign ministers issued a joint statement Tuesday calling for a ceasefire in Gaza, as they met in New York on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly.

  • Israeli forces have killed at least 29 Palestinians in air strikes on the Gaza Strip since the early hours of this morning, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, citing medical sources.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Palestinians rallied in the occupied West Bank to celebrate the recognition of Palestine by multiple Western countries.

  • Trump met with Arab and Muslim leaders on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly to discuss Gaza's post-war future. 

  • Turkish President Erdogan said the meeting on Gaza between Trump and leaders of Muslim countries was “very fruitful”.

  • Saudi Arabia's UN representative called on the Security Council to activate accountability measures against the Israeli government's recklessness.

  • Israeli soldiers stationed at the al-Quds Field Hospital in Gaza City prevented the entry and exit of patients and damaged the facility's oxygen station. 

  • Spain approved a law permanently banning the purchase and sale of arms and military equipment to Israel.

  • Qatar's Sheikh Tamim said that the Israeli attack on Doha was a blatant violation of international norms and constituted "state terrorism".

  • Israeli media reported that the Israel Football Association (IFA) is working to prevent a vote at Uefa on the suspension of Israel from all competitions over its genocidal war in Gaza.

title: Destruction of homes in Gaza makes displacement permanent, says UN
summary:
Destruction of homes in Gaza makes displacement permanent, says UN

The Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Tuesday said that the destruction of people’s homes in Gaza City by the Israeli military makes it likely that their displacement would be permanent.

Israel’s military actions are “inflicting terror on the Palestinian population of Gaza City and forcing tens of thousands to flee”.

The office said its partners estimated that as of Monday, more than 20,500 people had been displaced from the northern part of Gaza to the south, raising the overall number since mid-August to more than 321,200.

In a statement, the OHCHR cited a sharp increase in the number of civilians killed in Gaza City.

title: Motaz Azaiza on life after reporting in Gaza
summary:
Motaz Azaiza on life after reporting in Gaza

Submitted by Syma Mohammed on Tue, 09/23/2025 - 22:37
On the sidelines of UNGA, Azaiza tells Middle East Eye he is preoccupied with Gaza and welcomes Palestinian Authority taking control of the Strip
Photojournalist Motaz Azaiza speaks at a rally protesting the war in Gaza on 4 August 0 in New York City (Spencer Platt/AFP)
Off

As Motaz Azaiza walks around the UN plaza after a panel on reporting from conflict zones, people repeatedly stop him for photos and handshakes.

He became one of the most recognised photojournalists and faces from Gaza, with a social media following of 17 million people, before he took off his press vest and left the Strip in January.

Even though he is physically no longer elsewhere, his mind remains in Gaza.

“I'm not enjoying my life. I took my body from there, but all my mental energy is still directed out there," Motaz tells Middle East Eye.

“While I'm talking to you, people are sending me texts saying, ‘We need to evacuate people from Gaza City to Deir al Balah. We need water here. We need something. And I need to focus my energy on them. So once I finish my interviews, I'll wire money so they can leave."

Azaiza said that he is currently touring the US and trying to increase awareness about Gaza that can translate into assistance.

To help people in Gaza, he says he has created his own foundation, the Motaz Foundation Inc, to raise money and visibility for people there. 

“I'm tired, he says. “But I need to continue.”

He looks tired, but more than tired, he looks depleted. There is a lack of emotion in his eyes and his responses, which is markedly different from the person that people have come to know and love. I am told by an acquaintance that he is struggling with trauma from the war.

Palestinian Authority as a way out

When Azaiza is asked if he regrets taking off his press vest, he says he doesn’t.

“I don't regret taking it off. I regret leaving Gaza sometimes. But, if I do, I will just use this pin for covering it,” he says, pointing to a small metal ‘Press’ pin he is wearing.

He says he's unable to return to Gaza, but is committed to bringing help from the US. “I do a lot from here,” he says. “I help my people more. I bring more money to Gaza.”

While there has been a massive crackdown on pro-Palestinian speech in the US under both the Biden and Trump administrations, he said his experience in the US, so far, has been “not bad”.

“People here are very supportive. Sometimes I meet a policeman who is, like, hugging me or giving me more access. So there's a lot of good people”.

War on Gaza: Photojournalist Motaz Azaiza evacuates to Qatar
Read More »

He says he has noticed the shift in perception of Gaza while he has been in the US, which he says is “good for people outside of Gaza”, but has not made a difference to people inside. Azaiza is referring to a significant shift among Americans that recent polls show is moving in the direction of greater sympathy with Palestinians and the growing sentiment that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza. 

His family is still suffering and lives in fear. "This is our life,” he adds.

While western leaders are back slapping each other over recognising a Palestinian state, Azaiza doesn’t believe it will make a material difference to anyone in Gaza.

However, he does support the Palestinian Authority (PA) taking over control of Gaza.

“Everyone in Gaza wishes for them [PA] to come back to Gaza in control,” he says. "It's going make the life of Palestinians in Gaza easier."

“All countries recognise the PLO as the only representative. The Palestinian Authority is official government. Most of the people in Gaza – approximately 70 or 75 percent of employees in Gaza are PA employees. So everyone in Gaza is waiting for this. They are angry because they feel the PA is weak. The division between PA and Hamas is not allowing this. But they are hoping that one day they will come back”.

When pressed about the PA’s ability to carve out their own destiny, as many Palestinians view them as collaborators with Israel, he says that Palestinians want to go with “peaceful solutions”.

“It’s hard. We saw what happened after Hamas’s attack on Israel. What did it result in? All of Gaza destroyed. Hundreds of thousands of people killed. So fighting in this way alone, didn't bring anything for the people of Palestine. It didn’t bring any land. It didn't protect anyone”.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: After Israeli threat, drones hover over Global Sumud Flotilla
summary:
After Israeli threat, drones hover over Global Sumud Flotilla 

More than 15 drones flew at low altitude over one of the boats of the Global Sumud Flotilla on Monday, Anadolu news agency has reported. 

Organisers of the flotilla called the move an attempt to intimidate the humanitarian group and a "possible intelligence-gathering operation".

In a post on X, the flotilla said the drones appeared “roughly every 10 minutes” over a ship called the Alma, which is part of the convoy aiming to reach Gaza and challenge Israel’s illegal blockade.

“We believe these drones are intended to intimidate, potentially gathering intelligence for Israel,” the group said.

Israel on Tuesday threatened the Flotilla, saying it "will take the necessary measures to prevent its entry into the combat zone and to stop any violation of a lawful naval blockade”.

Earlier this week, Israel’s foreign ministry had warned the vessels against approaching Gaza’s coast, saying it should transfer the aid to Ashkelon port.

The flotilla, which includes dozens of boats, aims to break Israel’s blockade of Gaza and deliver aid to the besieged enclave.

title: Saudi Arabia: Situation in Gaza dangerous, Israel threatens to expand conflict
summary:
Saudi Arabia: Situation in Gaza dangerous, Israel threatens to expand conflict

Saudi Arabia's representative to the United Nations on Tuesday called on the Security Council to activate accountability measures against the Israeli government's recklessness.

"The situation in Gaza is dangerous and Israel threatens to expand the conflict. The Israeli attacks came as a result of the disruption of accountability," the representative said.  

"Common sense would not accept targeting Qatar while it was mediating to end the war," he said, adding that Israel violates international laws and norms.

title: Erdogan: Meeting between Trump and Muslim leaders very fruitful
summary:
Erdogan: Meeting between Trump and Muslim leaders very fruitful

Turkish President Erdogan on Tuesday said the meeting on Gaza between Trump and leaders of Muslim countries was “very fruitful”.

Erdogan said a joint declaration from the meeting would be published and that he was “pleased” with the outcome of the meeting.

Trump met with Arab and Muslim leaders on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly to discuss Gaza's post-war future. 

“I think we’ll be able to do it. This is the group that can do it,” Trump said as he sat with several leaders, including Qatari Emir Sheikh Tamim and Turkish President Erdogan.

“This is my most important meeting,” Trump said, adding that it was of the utmost importance to negotiate the release of captives in Israel.

title: Foreign Minister Araghchi engages in diplomatic talks at UN General Assembly

title: میرابیان: ایران تحت فشار مذاکره نمی‌کند؛ اسنپ‌بک بیشتر اثر روانی دارد
